qas.question: What was the first NES emulator?
What was the first English available emulator?
What platform was NESticle available for use?
What wasn't the first NES emulator?
What was the first Spanish available emulator?
What platform was NESticle unavailable for use?

context: The NES can be emulated on many other systems, most notably the PC. The first emulator was the Japanese-only <a0_0><b4_0>Pasofami<b4_0/><a0_0/>. It was soon followed by <a1_0><b5_0>iNES<b5_0/><a1_0/>, which was available in English and was cross-platform, in 1996. It was described as being the first NES emulation software that could be used by a non-expert. NESticle, a popular <a3_0><b7_0>MS-DOS<b7_0/><a3_0/> emulator, was released on <a2_0><b6_0>April 3, 1997<b6_0/><a2_0/>. There have since been many other emulators. The Virtual Console for the Wii, Nintendo 3DS and Wii U also offers emulation of many NES games.
